text: Python IndexError when trying to go through a large list
I have a list of approximately 200 000+ objects, each one representing a file (but not actually holding the file's contents, just the full path name and date).
The program I am writing copies any subset of these files, depending on the user-provided date range.
I first create a list of all of the files in the source directory (with the glob module), create an instance of my file-representation class and add that instance to a list, like so:
Now, to keep the copying of files quick and the block of code clean, I remove the LogFile objects that do not fit inside of the date range.

code:
for i in xrange(0, len(LOG_FILES)):
    if LOG_FILES[i].DATE < from_date or LOG_FILES[i].DATE > to_date:
        del(LOG_FILES[i])

text: Afterwards, I can just copy the files that are left in the list:

code:
for logfile in LOG_FILES:
    os.copy(logfile.PATH, destdir)

text: The issue occurs with the for i in xrange... example: I get thrown an IndexError when the value of i gets to 63792.

code: IndexError: list index out of range.

text: EDIT Thank you very much for the quick responses!
Now that I think about it, it was a silly oversight on my part.
